text: Fatima bint Muhammad (, or commonly known as Fatima al-Zahra (, born 605 or 615Ordoni (1992) pp.42-45 â€“ d. 633) was the youngest daughter of the Islamic prophet Muhammad and Khadija. Fatima's husband was Ali. They had four chijdren. She is often viewed as an ultimate role model for Muslim women and an example of compassion, generosity, and enduring suffering. The Fatimid Caliphate claimed to be her descendants. Her name and her epithets remain popular choices for Muslim girls. == References == * Category:600s births Category:633 deaths Category:Children of Muhammad
title: Fatimah
